meanings.definition: To be made up of; to be composed of
meanings.sent1: The team was constituted of players from different schools.
meanings.sent2: The cake was constituted of layers of chocolate and cream.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich constituted of only pickles and peanut butter was a strange choice.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter constituted a melody that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The colorful beads constituted a beautiful necklace.

meanings.definition: To be established or set up
meanings.sent1: The committee was constituted to address the community's concerns.
meanings.sent2: The rules constituted a fair system for all participants.
meanings.sent3: The makeshift tent constituted a cozy shelter for the night.
meanings.sent4: His words constituted a promise that he intended to keep.
meanings.sent5: The small garden constituted a peaceful retreat from the city noise.

meanings.definition: To be considered or regarded as
meanings.sent1: His actions constituted a violation of the school's code of conduct.
meanings.sent2: The painting constituted a masterpiece in the eyes of art critics.
meanings.sent3: The old hat constituted a fashion statement in her quirky outfit.
meanings.sent4: The handwritten letter constituted a heartfelt message of gratitude.
meanings.sent5: The historic building constituted a symbol of the town's heritage.
